summary: This bill, the "Black Farmers and Socially Disadvantaged Farmers Increased Market Share Act," aims to increase market access for Black farmers and socially disadvantaged farmers and ranchers. It establishes food hub grants, prioritizes purchases for USDA domestic food assistance programs, and provides tax credits for agricultural hubs. The bill also addresses civil rights accountability within the Department of Agriculture, offers equitable relief for certain farmers, and establishes an Office of the Civil Rights Ombudsperson. Additionally, it modifies the burden of proof in National Appeals Division hearings and amends provisions related to equitable relief.
